title.narrative: Enhance medical, social and advocacy support to acid and burn survivors in Nepal

description.narrative: The project aims to tackle burns violence and acid attacks in Nepal through a holistic care and support to victims of violence including medical, surgical, nutrition, physiotherapy, psycho-social counseling and reintegration and rehabilitation upon recovery along with education, awareness, evidence based advocacy and equipping public hospitals to treat burns.

activity-date.narrative: The project started on 17th October 2016 and was expected to end on 14th April 2017. BVS-N was granted No Cost Extension for a month.

mailing-address.narrative: Dhobigat, Kathmandu GPO Box 8975, EPC 1720 Phone: 01-5555689 Email: burnsurvivorsnepal@gmail.com

recipient-country.narrative: It's national level activity. The activity occurs in Nepal only

provider-org.narrative: UK AID DIRECT Community Partnership Grant

receiver-org.narrative: BVS-N is a pioneering and the only organization so far in Nepal to address Burns Violence and Acid Attacks through survivor support programs, intensive advocacy, awareness, research and strong networking.

sector.narrative: The project set out to intervene at all levels. On the ground, it directly engaged with victims of burns violence and acid attacks and offered them necessary support and services. Upon recovery, the survivors were engaged in income generation activities. While at the community level, it held a number of awareness programs. At policy level, it was engaged in lobbying and advocacy for a separate law on burns violence and acid attack.
